au.edu.federation.caliko

Class FabrikBone2D

  • java.lang.Object
    • au.edu.federation.caliko.FabrikBone2D

  • public class FabrikBone2D
extends Object
    A class to represent a FabrikBone2D object.

    A FabrikBone2D consists of a start location, an end location and a FabrikJoint2D which can constrain the rotation of the bone with regard to either the previous bone in the same chain or with regard to the direction of a bone in another chain which this bone is connected to.

    Version:
    0.9 - 11/12/2015
    Author:
    Al Lansley

    • Constructor Detail

      • FabrikBone2D

        public FabrikBone2D(Vec2f startLocation,
                    Vec2f endLocation)
        Constructor to create a new FabrikBone2D from a start and end location as provided by a pair of Vec2fs.

        The mLength property is calculated and set from the provided locations. All other properties are set to their default values.

        Instantiating a FabrikBone2D with the exact same start and end location, and hence a length of zero, may result in undefined behaviour.

        Parameters:
        startLocation - The start location of the bone in world space.
        endLocation - The end location of the bone in world space.

      • FabrikBone2D

        public FabrikBone2D(float startX,
                    float startY,
                    float endX,
                    float endY)
        Constructor to create a new FabrikBone2D from a start and end location as provided by a four floats.

        The mLength property is calculated and set from the provided locations. All other properties are set to their default values.

        Instantiating a FabrikBone2D with the exact same start and end location, and hence a length of zero, may result in undefined behaviour.

        Parameters:
        startX - The horizontal start location of the bone in world space.
        startY - The vertical start location of the bone in world space.
        endX - The horizontal end location of the bone in world space.
        endY - The vertical end location of the bone in world space.

      • FabrikBone2D

        public FabrikBone2D(Vec2f startLocation,
                    Vec2f directionUV,
                    float length)
        Constructor to create a new FabrikBone2D from a start location, a direction unit vector and a length.

        A normalised version of the direction unit vector is used to calculate the end location.

        If the provided direction unit vector is zero then an IllegalArgumentException is thrown. If the provided length argument is less than zero then an IllegalArgumentException is thrown.

        Instantiating a FabrikBone3D with a length of precisely zero may result in undefined behaviour.

        Parameters:
        startLocation - The start location of the bone in world-space.
        directionUV - The direction unit vector of the bone in world-space.
        length - The length of the bone in world-space units.

      • FabrikBone2D

        public FabrikBone2D(Vec2f startLocation,
                    Vec2f directionUV,
                    float length,
                    float cwConstraintDegs,
                    float acwConstraintDegs)
        Constructor to create a new FabrikBone2D from a start location, a direction unit vector, a length and a pair of constraint angles specified in degrees.

        The clockwise and anticlockwise constraint angles can be considered to be relative to the previous bone in the chain which this bone exists in UNLESS the bone is a basebone (i.e. the first bone in a chain) in which case, the constraint angles can optionally be made relative to either a world-space direction, the direction of the bone to which this bone may be connected, or to a direction relative to the coordinate space of the bone to which this bone may be connected.

        If the direction unit vector argument is zero then an IllegalArgumentException is thrown. If the length argument is less than zero then an IllegalArgumentException is thrown. If either the clockwise or anticlockwise constraint angles are outside of the range 0.0f degrees to 180.0f degrees then an IllegalArgumentException is thrown.

        Instantiating a FabrikBone3D with a length of precisely zero may result in undefined behaviour.

        Parameters:
        startLocation - The start location of the bone in world-space.
        directionUV - The direction unit vector of the bone in world-space.
        length - The length of the bone in world-space units.
        cwConstraintDegs - The clockwise constraint angle in degrees.
        acwConstraintDegs - The anticlockwise constraint angle in degrees.
        See Also:
        FabrikChain2D.BaseboneConstraintType2D

      • FabrikBone2D

        public FabrikBone2D(Vec2f startLocation,
                    Vec2f directionUV,
                    float length,
                    float cwConstraintDegs,
                    float acwConstraintDegs,
                    Colour4f colour)
        Constructor to create a new FabrikBone2D from a start location, a direction unit vector, a length, a pair of constraint angles specified in degrees and a colour.

        The clockwise and anticlockwise constraint angles can be considered to be relative to the previous bone in the chain which this bone exists in UNLESS the bone is a basebone (i.e. the first bone in a chain) in which case, the constraint angles can optionally be made relative to either a world-space direction, the direction of the bone to which this bone may be connected, or to a direction relative to the coordinate space of the bone to which this bone may be connected.

        If the direction unit vector argument is zero then an IllegalArgumentException is thrown. If the length argument is less than zero then an IllegalArgumentException is thrown. If either the clockwise or anticlockwise constraint angles are outside of the range 0.0f degrees to 180.0f degrees then an IllegalArgumentException is thrown.

        Instantiating a FabrikBone3D with a length of precisely zero may result in undefined behaviour.

        Parameters:
        startLocation - The start location of the bone in world-space.
        directionUV - The direction unit vector of the bone in world-space.
        length - The length of the bone in world-space units.
        cwConstraintDegs - The clockwise constraint angle in degrees.
        acwConstraintDegs - The anticlockwise constraint angle in degrees.
        colour - The colour with which to draw the bone.
        See Also:
        FabrikChain2D.BaseboneConstraintType2D

      • FabrikBone2D

        public FabrikBone2D(FabrikBone2D source)
        Copy constructor.

        Takes a source FabrikBone2D object and copies all properties into the new FabrikBone2D by value. Once this is done, there are no shared references between the source and the new object, and they are exact copies of each other.

        Parameters:
        source - The FabrikBone2D to clone.

    • Method Detail

      • length

        public float length()
        Return the length of this bone.

        Once the length of a bone has been set, either implicitly by a constructor that takes the start and end locations of the bone and calculates the distance between them, or by explicitly specifying the bone length, then it typically remains unchanged for the lifetime of the bone.

        Returns:
        The length of the bone in world-space, as stored in the mLength property.

      • setColour

        public void setColour(Colour4f colour)
        Set the colour used to draw this bone.

        Any colour component values outside the valid range of 0.0f to 1.0f inclusive are clamped to that range.

        Parameters:
        colour - The colour with which to draw this bone.

      • setJoint

        public void setJoint(FabrikJoint2D joint)
        Set the FabrikJoint2D object of this bone.
        Parameters:
        joint - The FabrikJoint2D which this bone should use.

      • getJoint

        public FabrikJoint2D getJoint()
        Get the FabrikJoint2D associated with this bone.

        Each FabrikBone2D has precisely one FabrikJoint2D. Although the joint does not have a location, it can conceptually be thought of to be located at the start location of the bone.

        Returns:
        The FabrikJoint2D associated with this bone.

      • setClockwiseConstraintDegs

        public void setClockwiseConstraintDegs(float angleDegs)
        Set the clockwise constraint angle of this bone's joint in degrees.

        The valid range of constraint angle is 0.0f degrees to 180.0f degrees inclusive, angles outside this range are clamped.

        Parameters:
        angleDegs - The clockwise constraint angle specified in degrees.

      • getClockwiseConstraintDegs

        public float getClockwiseConstraintDegs()
        Get the clockwise constraint angle of this bone's joint in degrees.
        Returns:
        the clockwise constraint angle in degrees.

      • setAnticlockwiseConstraintDegs

        public void setAnticlockwiseConstraintDegs(float angleDegs)
        Set the anticlockwise constraint angle of this bone's joint in degrees.

        The valid range of constraint angle is 0.0f degrees to 180.0f degrees inclusive.

        If a constraint angle outside of this range is provided then an IllegalArgumentException is thrown.

        Parameters:
        angleDegs - The anticlockwise constraint angle specified in degrees.

      • getAnticlockwiseConstraintDegs

        public float getAnticlockwiseConstraintDegs()
        Get the anticlockwise constraint angle of this bone's joint in degrees.
        Returns:
        the anticlockwise constraint angle in degrees.

      • getDirectionUV

        public Vec2f getDirectionUV()
        Get the direction unit vector between the start location and end location of this bone.

        If the opposite (i.e. end to start) location is required then you can simply negate the provided direction.

        Returns:
        The direction unit vector of this bone.
        See Also:
        Vec2f.negated()

      • setLineWidth

        public void setLineWidth(float lineWidth)
        Set the line width with which to draw this bone.

        The value set is clamped to be between 1.0f and 64.0f inclusive, if necessary.

        Parameters:
        lineWidth - The width of the line to draw this bone in pixels.

      • setName

        public void setName(String name)
        Set the name of this bone, capped to 100 characters if required.
        Parameters:
        name - The name to set.

      • getName

        public String getName()
        Return the name of this bone.
        Returns:
        The name of this bone.

      • toString

        public String toString()
        Return a concise, human readable description of this FabrikBone2D as a String. The colour and line-width are not included in this output, but can be queried separately via the getColour and getLineWidth methods.
        Overrides:
        toString in class Object
